Installation¶

nnetsauce is currently available for Python and R.

For Python¶

Stable version From Pypi:

pip install nnetsauce

Development version From GitHub. For this to work, you’ll first need to have Git installed :

pip install git+https://github.com/thierrymoudiki/nnetsauce.git

For R¶

In R console, type:

install.packages("devtools") # if devtools isn't installed yet
library(devtools)
devtools::install_github("thierrymoudiki/nnetsauce/R-package")
library(nnetsauce)

General rule for using the package in R (the API is identical): object accesses with .’s are replaced by $’s. For R examples, you can type the following command in R console:

# CustomRegressor is a nnetsauce class
help("CustomRegressor")

And read section Examples in the Help page displayed. Any other class name of the API Documentation (see sections Regression models, Classification models and Time series models) can be used instead of CustomRegressor.

Next section presents some examples of use of nnetsauce in Python, that are representative of its general philosophy, but not exhaustive. For more examples, you can refer to these notebooks or this directory; feel free to contribute yours in there too, with the following naming convention: yourgithubname_ddmmyy_shortdescriptionofdemo.[py|ipynb|R|Rmd].
